definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: I find salesmanship beyond my reach.
sentences.chinese: 我发现我我搞不了推销。

sentences.english: You may have to do a little self-promotion, but try not to come off as a braggart.
sentences.chinese: 你可以做点自我推销，但是不要过了头成了牛皮专家。

sentences.english: Other Titles: Some Feelings of Poetry, "The Yellow Wall Paper", and "the Death of Salesman"
sentences.chinese: 对于一些英诗，黄色壁纸，及推销员之死之读后杂感。

sentences.english: The selling concept takes an inside-out perspective.
sentences.chinese: 推销观念采用一种由内而外的视角。

sentences.english: Learning the skills of salesmanship takes time and effort.
sentences.chinese: 学习推销技术要花时间，花力气。

sentences.english: I know I am weak at promoting myself.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，在自我推销方面自己很弱。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 一个成功的推销员必须要有闯劲。

sentences.english: For several years he was Watkins' top retail salesman.
sentences.chinese: 他连着几年都是沃特金斯公司的最佳零售推销员。

sentences.english: They were the dupes of a clever but dishonest salesman.
sentences.chinese: 他们被一个聪明但不诚实的推销员骗了。

sentences.english: The salesman brought some samples of his firm's products.
sentences.chinese: 推销员带来了一些他公司的产品货样。

sentences.english: Advertising is just not about selling you something.
sentences.chinese: 广告不仅仅是推销你东西的方式。

sentences.english: They are more persuasive and sell ideas and products more successfully.
sentences.chinese: 他们更有说服力，更容易成功地推销观点和产品。

sentences.english: A sales leter is a means of advertising.
sentences.chinese: 推销信是广告的一种方式。

sentences.english: That said, there's nothing wrong with aggressive self-promotion.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，积极的自我推销是没有错的。

sentences.english: This means being an unabashed self promoter.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你要厚着脸皮的自我推销。

definition: to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to sell as agent/to sell on commission (e.g. insurance policies)/proxy sale (of stocks)
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
